tasks.title: AI service integration layer
tasks.description: Create local-first AI service with Ollama auto-detection, cloud fallbacks (OpenAI, DeepSeek, Anthropic), concept extraction, card format suggestions, and medical content processing
tasks.details:
Create electron/ai-service.ts with local-first, cloud-ready architecture:

PROVIDER LAYER:
- Auto-detect Ollama on localhost:11434 (preferred - free, private)
- OpenAI-compatible SDK with configurable baseURL (supports Ollama, OpenAI, DeepSeek)
- Anthropic SDK as secondary provider (different API format)
- Provider presets: { ollama, openai, deepseek, anthropic } with baseURL, model, timeout
- Environment config: AI_PROVIDER, AI_BASE_URL, AI_API_KEY, AI_MODEL
- Configurable timeout: 10s for local models, 3s for cloud APIs

CORE FUNCTIONS:
- extractConcepts(content: string): Promise<ExtractedConcept[]> - analyzes pasted content, returns array of {text, conceptType, confidence, suggestedFormat: 'qa'|'cloze'}
- validateCard(card: {front, back}): Promise<ValidationResult> - checks minimum information principle, pattern-matching detection, multi-fact warnings
- detectMedicalList(content: string): Promise<{isList: boolean, listType: 'differential'|'procedure'|'algorithm', items: string[]}>
- convertToVignette(listItem: string, context: string): Promise<{vignette: string, cloze: string}>
- suggestTags(content: string): Promise<string[]> - medical domain tag suggestions
- findRelatedNotes(content: string, existingNotes: DbNote[]): Promise<{noteId: string, similarity: number}[]> - semantic similarity

INFRASTRUCTURE:
- Retry logic with exponential backoff (3 attempts max)
- Cache results for 5 minutes to reduce API costs
- Create src/types/ai.ts for all AI-related interfaces
- Provider health check on startup

tasks.title: Auto-start Ollama from Electron on first AI request
tasks.description: Automatically start Ollama when the app needs AI services, eliminating the friction of manually starting Ollama before using the app
tasks.details:
Update electron/ai-service.ts to auto-start Ollama:

1. Create ensureOllamaRunning() function:
   - Check if Ollama is already running via detectOllamaAvailable()
   - If not running, spawn('ollama', ['serve']) with detached: true, stdio: 'ignore'
   - Wait for Ollama to be ready (retry detection up to 10 times with 500ms intervals)
   - Return true if started successfully, false if failed

2. Update getClient() or initializeClient():
   - Before returning client, call ensureOllamaRunning() if provider is 'ollama'
   - Log startup status to console
   - If Ollama can't start, fall back to cloud provider and notify user via IPC

3. Add IPC handler for AI status notifications:
   - ai:ollamaStarted - notify renderer when Ollama auto-started
   - ai:ollamaFailed - notify renderer when Ollama couldn't start (show toast)

4. Handle Windows/macOS/Linux differences:
   - Windows: 'ollama.exe' may need full path or PATH lookup
   - macOS/Linux: 'ollama' should work if installed via standard methods
   - Check for ollama in PATH first, then common install locations

5. Graceful degradation:
   - If Ollama not installed, detect and inform user
   - Offer to use cloud API as fallback (requires API key)
   - Don't block app startup, just disable AI features gracefully
tasks.testStrategy: Test with Ollama installed but not running → verify auto-start works. Test with Ollama already running → verify no duplicate process. Test with Ollama not installed → verify graceful fallback message. Test on Windows specifically. Verify AI extraction works after auto-start.

WORTHINESS RUBRIC:

1. BOARD-RELEVANT:
- Is this high-yield for Step 2/3 or specialty boards?
- AI checks against known high-yield topics
- Weight: High

2. TESTABLE:
- Does this have a clear, unambiguous answer?
- Avoid opinion-based or 'it depends' content
- Weight: High

3. DISCRIMINATIVE:
- Does this distinguish from similar concepts?
- Avoid cards that could apply to multiple conditions
- Weight: Medium

4. MINIMUM INFORMATION:
- Single concept per card?
- Not testing multiple facts at once?
- Weight: High

5. NO PATTERN MATCHING:
- Answer not giveaway from card format?
- Could be rephrased and still work?
- Weight: Medium

SCORING:
- Each criterion: Pass / Warning / Fail
- Overall: CREATE / CONSIDER EDITING / NOT RECOMMENDED
- Show reasoning for each criterion

tasks.description: Replace fixed time thresholds (<5s=Easy, 5-15s=Good, etc.) with personalized baselines. Grade relative to user's own response patterns rather than absolute time. Research shows response latency correlates with retrieval strength (Bjork 1994, PMC4480221).
tasks.details:

- Response latency is a valid proxy for retrieval difficulty (PMC4480221)

4. Grade relative to baseline:
   - <50% of baseline = Easy (fast for you)
   - 50-100% of baseline = Good (normal for you)
   - 100-200% of baseline = Hard (slow for you)
   - >200% of baseline = Again (struggled)
5. Cold start: use fixed thresholds until 20+ reviews exist
6. Weighted recency: recent reviews weighted higher than old ones
7. Add analytics dashboard showing personal response time trends
